title: The Bookstore of the dead.
content:
There’s a used bookstore I drop by at least once a week. I assume that many of the books come from estates of the many elderly women in the neighborhood who spend their final years in a decrepit old mansion before dying, leaving behind a house full of junk that smells of mold, mothballs, and cat urine. Their books are rarely anything special, so they tend to get unceremoniously dumped on the discount tables outside. I can walk up to these tables and learn about the latest deaths in my neighborhood.

Last week it was apparently an old German woman with a thing for painters and the modernism that sprung from the Vienna secessionists.
author: James Puckett

comments.content: Sounds fabulous. Like something out of a short story by Calvino or Borges. Did you buy anything of this mitteleuropean material?
No books for me today. It was mostly old art books, which I rarely buy given how much better the printing is these days. That and I’ve run out of shelf space and started shelving two deep!
James, one day it will be your books on the discount tables ... Hope it will take some fifty something years.

_That and I’ve run out of shelf space..._

LOL. I’ve just put another four shelves up. I look forward (someday) to my own decrepit mansion, populated by old books and felines!
